list_definition.mean_english: có lợi từ cái gì/làm gì
list_definition.definition: (often with byor from) to get (something good) by doing something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: What do I have to gain by staying here?
He gained strength after his illness.

list_definition.definition: (of a clock or watch) to go too fast

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: This clock gains (four minutes a day).

list_ex_of_english: They all gained some position of status, never mind how, sufficient to win the respect of the general public.
First, how do the opportunities for private gain differ in different electoral systems?
Spreading a reproduction before students and colleagues always gains a response, usually verbal.
Enlightenment, in this sense, is gained through communities.
As the stimulus became larger, more long-range axons were recruited into the collective oscillation, thereby increasing the gain of the feedback circuit.
The thermal mass in superinsulated housing is not able to store all this solar energy, so the useful solar gains are greatly reduced.
More importantly, by studying the subjective experiences of the meaning of music we gain insights into the person's self.
Numerous political parties have gained representation, and they all have a stake in the survival of the regime.
